New Records: Jamal Murray recorded 21 points and nine assists, while Russell Westbrook added 19 points and eight assists in the Nuggets' win over the Clippers.
The Nuggets improved to 8-0 on the second leg of back-to-backs, highlighting their strong performance despite Nikola Jokic's absence.
Key Match Events: Denver Nuggets utilized a 20-3 run in the first quarter to establish a strong lead early in the game.
DeAndre Jordan contributed significantly with a season-high 12 points and nine rebounds, playing a key role in the Nuggets' victory.
Pre-Game Insights: Nikola Jokic was out due to illness, and DeAndre Jordan started in his place, providing a crucial presence for the Nuggets.
The Clippers faced challenges without Kawhi Leonard, who was unavailable due to family concerns related to wildfires.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Clippers struggled with free throws, missing 5 of 15 attempts in the third quarter, impacting their performance.
Norman Powell continued his strong performance with 30 points, maintaining a 27.6 average against the Nuggets.
Others: The game was part of the Nuggets' back-to-back schedule, highlighting their ability to perform under challenging circumstances.
